After completing the Ashley Young deal with Manchester United, Inter are looking to make more moves for the wing-back position. On the outgoings front, Valentino Lazaro has become a target for Newcastle and the Austrian's agent is in England to discuss term with the Magpies, after that the two clubs reached an agreement for a loan with option to buy.

On the flipside, Inter are waiting for Victor Moses, after that Chelsea gave the green light for a move tp the Nerazzurri. The Nigerian wing-back is currently on loan at Fenerbahce, where he made six appearances this season so far. The Italian club is waiting for the Turkish side's go-ahead to terminate the loan, so that Chelsea can loan him out again at the Nerazzurri

People have very short memories.

Never would we have dreamed in the last 10 years that we would be able to sign a player like Eriksen. And now, with a full agreement in place with the player and the strong negotiating position, Inter is seeking to pay a reasonable fee instead of over-paying what a player with only 6 months of contract is worth.

Will Eriksen win us the scudetto? Probably not. So then how can we justify the €20m spend now, if he won't generate the €20m extra in prize money?

Do I want us to sign Eriksen immediately so I can see us win more games? Yes of course, but from a finance perspective, I'm not gonna complain about Inter's management for strong arming Tottenham with our agreement with the player to try and force them to accept. The reality is, the closer to the end of the window you get, the more likely Tottenham is going to take whatever they can get.

Some are even saying that we are losing points because we haven't signed him. Now if we are losing points against Lecce because we dont have Eriksen, then we DEFINITELY dont have a good enough squad to compete for the scudetto, which in itself invalidates the financial potential for Eriksen to justify spending €20m on him with 6 months left on his contract.

Be patient, Marotta knows what he is doing and we will get Eriksen by the end of January. We clearly need re-enforcements in midfield and that will be delivered to Conte without a doubt. We shouldn't need Eriksen to beat Lecce and Cagliari.

Just think back to all the shit players we have seen over the years and then remember that we have a full agreement with Christian Eriksen to join us in less than 10 days.

Be patient.

Forza Inter.
🔵⚫🔵⚫🔵⚫🔵⚫🔵

Napoli-Inter, the latest on Politano: Llorente could join deal

Inter and Napoli continue to work on the transfer of Matteo Politano. Today there was a meeting at noon between Napoli director of sport Giuntoli and the nerazzurri directors to find an agreeement, which still hasn't been done definitively. There has not been a complete agreement on the method of payment as well as the total asking price of 25 million euros, set by Inter. There is an agreement on the formula of a transfer, however, but Napoli are offering less when you consider bonuses. For this reason the parties are continuing to talk.

Giuntoli will also begin talking to Politano's representatives to also find an agreement with the player. The two clubs are also discussing whether or not Llorente can be thrown into the deal as a loan to Inter. If this is the case, it would halt any transfer of Oliver Giroud to Inter from Chelsea, even though the Milanese club has had an agreement with the player for some time.

The two clubs would also have to define the formula and the financial details of the swap. Everton, who are managed by former Napoli manager Carlo Ancelotti, are also interested.

After days of meetings between the agents of Inter's Valentino Lazaro and Newcastle and Leipzig, there has been a conclusion made on his future. Newcastle has this morning made the decisive move to seal the transfer for the fullback ahead of the German club. The deal reached with Inter is a loan for €1.5m with an option to buy fixed at €23.5m. The sale of Lazaro comes just after Inter officially announced the purchase of Victor Moses, as the nerazzurri look to improve the team especially on their flanks.

Flamengo vice president Marcos Braz and executive director Bruno Spindel arrived in Milan yesterday to finalise a deal with Inter for Gabriel ‘Gabigol’ Barbosa according to a report from Fox Sports Brasil.
The exact details of the deal between the clubs are as yet unclear although going off of various reports both in Italy and Brazil, the transfer fee will be between €18-20 million.
Some reports have stated Inter will have a clause which entitles them to a % of a future sale whilst others have stated that this will not be the case.
Gabigol spent the whole of 2019 out on loan at the Rio de Janeiro based club and wrote his name into the club’s history books as he helped them to win the Campeonato Brasileiro Série A and Copa Libertadores and finish runners up in the Club World Cup.
The 23-year-old Brazilian international made 58 appearances for Flamengo, in which he scored 43 goals and provided 13 assists for his teammates.
